intro: Alectra glandulosa, commonly known as the stickyweed or glandular alectra, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Alectra glandulosa is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
